subject: @BeforeClass, subclassing, order

messageBody:
I'm just moving from Junit 3 to 4 and want to use @BeforeClass in a
particular way. There doesn't seem to be a way to do what I want, but
I just thought I'd check...

I have a large number of test classes and they each need a one-time
startup and one-time shutdown. So the sequence of events is like this:

Test Class A
startup
test1
test2
test3
shutdown
Test Class B
startup
test1
test2
shutdown

Now, the startup for each test class is nearly identical except for
one small difference. I want to put that one small difference in each
test class, but put the startup code in a superclass. Like this:

TestsSuperclass
@BeforeClass
public static void startup() {
...do startup stuff, using one piece of info from currently running
subclass
}

I don't see any way to get info from the subclass into that startup
method.

If Java allowed static methods to be subclassed, that would solve it.
But no.

If the @BeforeClass methods would run subclass first, then superclass,
then in the subclass I could set a static variable defined in the
superclass. But no.

If Junit allowed @BeforeClass to be non-static, it would be easy. But no.

Am I missing something? Or am I just stuck with putting the startup
code in every subclass's @BeforeClass?

Thanks,

Lee
